page.title: 17Place names in Codford
page.content: The Wylye Valley is called Death Valley. It is named that because of the number of car accidents there have been over the past years on the A36. In Codford since 1914 there has been a hill called Misery Hill. It is named so from the Australian and New Zealand bodies that are buried there. There is another hill which is called Malmepit Hill because there is an old chalk quarry there.Cow Lane got its name because cows go down it to other fields.Green Lane was once a track which only people on foot or horse and cart could go though. On each side of the track there were lush green fields. The Grove received its name from the old Grove Farm. Cherry Orchard was once a large field dotted with Cherry Trees.
